00029 #include <Python.h>
00030 #include <frameobject.h>
00031 
00032 #include "BLI_path_util.h"
00033 #include "BLI_string.h"
00034 
00035 #include "bpy_traceback.h"
00036 
00037 static const char *traceback_filepath(PyTracebackObject *tb, PyObject **coerce)
00038 {
00039     return PyBytes_AS_STRING((*coerce = PyUnicode_EncodeFSDefault(tb->tb_frame->f_code->co_filename)));
00040 }
00041 
00042 /* copied from pythonrun.c, 3.2.0 */
00043 static int
00044 parse_syntax_error(PyObject *err, PyObject **message, const char **filename,
00045                    int *lineno, int *offset, const char **text)
00046 {
00047     long hold;
00048     PyObject *v;
00049 
00050     /* old style errors */
00051     if (PyTuple_Check(err))
00052         return PyArg_ParseTuple(err, "O(ziiz)", message, filename,
00053                                 lineno, offset, text);
00054 
00055     /* new style errors.  `err' is an instance */
00056 
00057     if (!(v = PyObject_GetAttrString(err, "msg")))
00058         goto finally;
00059     *message = v;
00060 
00061     if (!(v = PyObject_GetAttrString(err, "filename")))
00062         goto finally;
00063     if (v == Py_None)
00064         *filename = NULL;
00065     else if (!(*filename = _PyUnicode_AsString(v)))
00066         goto finally;
00067 
00068     Py_DECREF(v);
00069     if (!(v = PyObject_GetAttrString(err, "lineno")))
00070         goto finally;
00071     hold = PyLong_AsLong(v);
00072     Py_DECREF(v);
00073     v = NULL;
00074     if (hold < 0 && PyErr_Occurred())
00075         goto finally;
00076     *lineno = (int)hold;
00077 
00078     if (!(v = PyObject_GetAttrString(err, "offset")))
00079         goto finally;
00080     if (v == Py_None) {
00081         *offset = -1;
00082         Py_DECREF(v);
00083         v = NULL;
00084     }
00085     else {
00086         hold = PyLong_AsLong(v);
00087         Py_DECREF(v);
00088         v = NULL;
00089         if (hold < 0 && PyErr_Occurred())
00090             goto finally;
00091         *offset = (int)hold;
00092     }
00093 
00094     if (!(v = PyObject_GetAttrString(err, "text")))
00095         goto finally;
00096     if (v == Py_None)
00097         *text = NULL;
00098     else if (!PyUnicode_Check(v) ||
00099              !(*text = _PyUnicode_AsString(v)))
00100         goto finally;
00101     Py_DECREF(v);
00102     return 1;
00103 
00104 finally:
00105     Py_XDECREF(v);
00106     return 0;
00107 }
00108 /* end copied function! */
00109 
00110 
00111 void python_script_error_jump(const char *filepath, int *lineno, int *offset)
00112 {
00113     PyObject *exception, *value;
00114     PyTracebackObject *tb;
00115 
00116     *lineno = -1;
00117     *offset = 0;
00118 
00119     PyErr_Fetch(&exception, &value, (PyObject **)&tb);
00120 
00121     if (exception && PyErr_GivenExceptionMatches(exception, PyExc_SyntaxError)) {
00122         /* no traceback available when SyntaxError.
00123          * python has no api's to this. reference parse_syntax_error() from pythonrun.c */
00124         PyErr_NormalizeException(&exception, &value, (PyObject **)&tb);
00125         PyErr_Restore(exception, value, (PyObject *)tb);  /* takes away reference! */
00126 
00127         if (value) { /* should always be true */
00128             PyObject *message;
00129             const char *filename, *text;
00130 
00131             if (parse_syntax_error(value, &message, &filename, lineno, offset, &text)) {
00132                 /* python adds a '/', prefix, so check for both */
00133                 if ((BLI_path_cmp(filename, filepath) == 0) ||
00134                     ((filename[0] == '\\' || filename[0] == '/') && BLI_path_cmp(filename + 1, filepath) == 0))
00135                 {
00136                     /* good */
00137                 }
00138                 else {
00139                     *lineno = -1;
00140                 }
00141             }
00142             else {
00143                 *lineno = -1;
00144             }
00145         }
00146     }
00147     else {
00148         PyErr_NormalizeException(&exception, &value, (PyObject **)&tb);
00149         PyErr_Restore(exception, value, (PyObject *)tb);  /* takes away reference! */
00150         PyErr_Print();
00151 
00152         for (tb = (PyTracebackObject *)PySys_GetObject("last_traceback");
00153              tb && (PyObject *)tb != Py_None;
00154              tb = tb->tb_next)
00155         {
00156             PyObject *coerce;
00157             const char *tb_filepath = traceback_filepath(tb, &coerce);
00158             const int match = ((BLI_path_cmp(tb_filepath, filepath) == 0) ||
00159                                ((tb_filepath[0] == '\\' || tb_filepath[0] == '/') && BLI_path_cmp(tb_filepath + 1, filepath) == 0));
00160             Py_DECREF(coerce);
00161 
00162             if (match) {
00163                 *lineno = tb->tb_lineno;
00164                 /* used to break here, but better find the inner most line */
00165             }
00166         }
00167     }
00168 }
